author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF Two men went on dromedaries three days ago to see if the gods
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were still at Marma.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They went to Marma!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF Yes, three days ago.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO We are lost.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They went three days ago?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF Yes, on dromedaries.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They should be back to-day.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO We are lost.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN We are lost.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF They must have seen the green jade idols sitting against the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountains. They will say, 'The gods are still at Marma.' And we shall
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be burnt.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG My Master will yet devise a plan.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR (to the Thief) Slip away to some high place and look towards the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: desert and see how long we have to devise a plan. (Exit Thief.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG My Master will devise a plan.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO He has taken us into a trap.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN His wisdom is our doom.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG He will find a wise plan yet. (Re-enter Thief.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF It is too late.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR It is too late?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF The dromedary men are here.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO We are lost.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR Be silent! I must think. (They all sit still. Citizens enter and
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prostrate themselves. Agmar sits deep in thought.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN (to Agmar) Two holy pilgrims have gone to your sacred
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shrines, wherein you were wont to sit before you left the mountains.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: (Agmar says nothing) They return even now.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They left us here and went to find the gods. A fish once took a
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journey into a far country to find the sea.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN Most reverend Deity, their piety is so great that they have
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gone to worship even your shrines.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR I know these men that have great piety. Such men have often
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prayed to me before, but their prayers are not acceptable. They little
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: love the gods, their only care is their piety. I know these pious
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ones. They will say that the seven gods were still at Marma. So shall
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they seem more pious to you all, pretending that they alone have seen
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gods. Fools shall believe them and share in their damnation.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OORANDER (to Illanaun) Hush. You anger the gods.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN I am not sure whom I anger.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OORANDER It may be they are the gods.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN Where are these men from Marma?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: CITIZEN Here are the dromedary men, they are coming now.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN (to Agmar) The holy pilgrims from your shrine are come to
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worship you.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR The men are doubters. How the gods hate the word! Doubt ever
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: contaminated virtue. Let them be cast into prison and not besmirch
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: your purity, (rising) Let them not enter here.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN But O most reverened Deity from the mountain, we also doubt,
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: most reverend Deity.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR You have chosen. You have chosen. And yet it is not too late.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Repent and cast these men in prison and it may not be too late. _The
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods have never wept_. And yet when they think upon damnation and the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dooms that are withering a myriad bones, then almost, were they not
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: divine, they _could_ weep. Be quick. Repent of your doubt.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN Most reverend Deity, it is a mighty doubt.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: CITIZENS _Nothing has killed him! They are not the gods_!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG (to Agmar) You have a plan, my Master. You have a plan?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR Not yet, Slag. (Enter the dromedary men.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN (to Oorander) These are the men that went to the shrines at
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Marma.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OORANDER (in a loud, clear voice) Were the gods of the mountain seated
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still at Marma, or were they not there? (The beggars get up hurriedly
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from their thrones.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: DROMEDARY MAN They were not there.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ILLANAUN They were not there?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: DROMEDARY MAN Their shrines were empty.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OORANDER Behold the gods of the mountain!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AKMOS They have indeed come from Marma.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OORANDER Come. Let us go away to prepare a sacrifice, a mighty
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sacrifice to atone for our doubting. (Exeunt.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG My most wise Master!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR No, no, Slag. I do not know what has befallen. When I went by
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Marma only two weeks ago the idols of green jade were still seated
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO We are saved now.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN Aye, we are saved.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR We are saved, but I know not how.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO _Never_ had beggars such a time.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF I will go out and watch. (He creeps out.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF Yet I have a fear.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO A fear? Why, we are saved.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF Last night I dreamed.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO What was your dream?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF It was nothing. I dreamed that I was thirsty and one gave me
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Woldery wine; yet there was a fear in my dream.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN When I drink Woldery wine I am afraid of nothing. (Re-enter
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thief.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF They are making a pleasant banquet ready for us; they are
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: killing lambs, and girls are there with fruits, and there is to be
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: much Woldery wine.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN Never had beggars such a time.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR Do any doubt us now?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF I do not know.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN When will the banquet be?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF When the stars come out.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO Ah. It is sunset already. There will be good eating.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN We shall see the girls come in with baskets upon their heads.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO There will be fruits in the baskets.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN All the fruits of the valley.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN Ah, how long we have wandered along the ways of the world.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG Ah, how hard they were.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN And how dusty.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO And how little wine.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN How long we have asked and asked, and for how much!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR We to whom all things are coming now at last.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF I fear lest my art forsake me now that good things come without
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stealing.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR You will need your art no longer.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG The wisdom of my Master shall suffice us all our days. (Enter a
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frightened man. He kneels before Agmar and abases his forehead.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Master, we implore you, the people beseech you. (Agmar and the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beggars in the attitude of the gods sit silent.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Master, it is terrible. (The beggars maintain silence) It is
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: terrible when you wander in the evening. It is terrible on the edge of
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the desert in the evening. Children die when they see you.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR In the desert? When did you see us?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Last night, Master. You were terrible last night. You were
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: terrible in the gloaming. When your hands were stretched out and
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: groping. You were feeling for the city.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR Last night do you say?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN You were terrible in the gloaming!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR You yourself saw us?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Yes, Master, you were terrible. Children too saw you and they
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: died.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR You say you saw us?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Yes, Master. Not as you are now, but otherwise. We implore you,
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Master, not to wander at evening. You are terrible in the gloaming.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: You are....
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR You say we appeared not as we are now. How did we appear to you?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Otherwise, Master, otherwise.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR But how _did_ we appear to you?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN You were all green, Master, all green in the gloaming, all of rock
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again as you used to be in the mountains. Master, we can bear to see
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: you in flesh like men, but when we see rock walking it is terrible, it
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: is terrible.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR That is how we appeared to you?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Yes, Master. Rock should not walk. When children see it they do
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not understand. Rock should not walk in the evening.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR There have been doubters of late. Are they satisfied?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MAN Master, they are terrified. Spare us, Master.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR It is wrong to doubt. Go, and be faithful. (Exit Man.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG What have they seen, Master?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They have seen their own fears dancing in the desert. They have
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seen something green after the light was gone, and some child has told
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them a tale that it was us. I do not know what they have seen. What
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: should they have seen?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF Something was coming this way from the desert, he said.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG What should come from the desert?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR They are a foolish people.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF That man's white face has seen some frightful thing.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG A frightful thing?
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF That man's face has been near to some frightful thing.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR It is only we that have frightened them, and their fears have
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made them foolish. (Enter an attendant with a torch or lantern which
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he places in a receptacle. Exit.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN Now we shall see the faces of the girls when they come to the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: banquet.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN Never had beggars such a time.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR Hark! They are coming. I hear footsteps.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN The dancing girls. They are coming.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THIEF There is no sound of flutes; they said they would come with
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: music.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OOGNO What heavy boots they have, they sound like feet of stone.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN I do not like to hear their heavy tread; those that would dance
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to _us_ must be light of foot.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR I shall not smile at them if they are not airy.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MLAN They are coming very slowly. They should come nimbly to us.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THAHN They should dance as they come. But the footfall is like the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: footfall of heavy crabs.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ULF (in a loud voice, almost chaunting) I have a fear, an old fear and
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a boding. We have done ill in the sight of the seven gods; beggars we
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were and beggars we should have remained; we have given up our calling
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and come in sight of our doom: I will no longer let my fear be silent:
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it shall run about and cry: it shall go from me crying, like a dog
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from out of a doomed city; for my fear has seen calamity and has known
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: an evil thing.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: SLAG (hoarsely) Master!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR (rising) Come, come! (They listen. No one speaks. The stony
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: boots come on. Enter in single file a procession of seven green men,
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even hands and faces are green; they wear greenstone sandals, they
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: walk with knees extremely wide apart, as having sat cross-legged for
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: centuries, their right arms and right forefingers point upwards, right
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: elbows resting on left hands: they stoop grotesquely: halfway to the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: footlights they wheel left. They pass in front of the seven beggars,
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now in terrified attitudes and six of them sit down in the attitude
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: described, with their backs to the audience. The leader stands, still
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stooping. Just as they wheel left, OOGNO cries out.) The gods of the
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain!
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: AGMAR (hoarsely) Be still. They are dazzled by the light, they may not
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: see us. (The leading green thing points his forefinger at the lantern,
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the flame turns green. When the six are seated the leader points one
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by one at each of the seven beggars, shooting out his forefinger at
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them. As he does this each beggar in his turn gathers himself back on
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to his throne and crosses his legs, his right arm goes stiffly upwards
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with forefinger erect, and a staring look of horror comes into his
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes. In this attitude the beggars sit motionless while a green light
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: falls upon their faces. The gods go out.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Presently enter the Citizens, some with victuals and fruit. One
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: touches a beggar's arm and then another's.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: CITIZEN They are cold; they have turned to stone. (All abase
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: themselves foreheads to the floor.)
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ONE We have doubted them. We have doubted them. They have turned to
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stone because we have doubted them.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ANOTHER They were the true gods.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ALL They were the true gods.
title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Selections from the Writings of Lord Dunsany
